Items.Title:
The City Clerk raps the gavel three times and states:
“I call the Meeting to order.”
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk and Clerk of the Council (Mr. McSweeney) rapped the gavel three times and called the Meeting to order.

Items.Title:
The City Clerk states:
“Will the Clerk please read the call for today’s Charter Meeting.”
The Clerk reads:
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) then read the Call for the Charter Meeting.

Items.Title:
The City Clerk then states:
“Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, I hereby call this meeting to order and direct the Clerk to read the communication from the Board of Elections stating the list of elected City Council Members.”
 
The Clerk reads:
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) then stated that pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, he was calling the Meeting to order and read the communication from the Board of Elections stating the list of elected City Council Members.

Items.Title:
The City Clerk will then state:
“I will now perform the formal ceremony of the duly elected Council Members taking their oath of office.”
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) performed the formal ceremony of swearing in the duly elected Council Members by taking theor Oath of Office.

Items.Title:
The City Clerk will then request:
“Will the Clerk call the Roll for the purpose of ascertaining the presence of a quorum.”
After ascertaining from the Clerk that there is a quorum, the City Clerk will then announce:
“We have a quorum.”
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) then called the Roll for the purpose of ascertaining the presence of a quorum.

Items.Title:
The City Clerk will state:
“Please rise for today’s invocation delivered by Minister Jason S. Riffe Abyssinian Baptist Church, 132 Odell Clarke Place, New York, NY 10031”

The City Clerk will recognize Council Member Dickens

Council Member Dickens will make the motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record.

The City Clerk states:
“So ordered.”
Items.MinutesNote: The Invocation was delivered by Minister Jason S. Riffe Abyssinian Baptist Church, 132 Odell Clarke Place, New York, NY 10031.

Items.Title: The City Clerk will recognize Council Member Dickens:
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Dickens moved to spread the Invocation in full on the record.

Items.Title: NOMINATION OF THE SPEAKER
MESSAGES & PAPERS FROM THE MAYOR
PETITIONS & COMMUNICATIONS
The Acting President Pro-Tempore will then recognize the Speaker
Items.MinutesNote: The Public Advocate (Ms. James) recognized the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito).

Items.Title:
Communication from the Speaker
See Attached
RECESS OR ADJOURNMENT
Items.MinutesNote: At this point, the Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viveroto) asked for a recess of the Charter Meeting subject to call.

Items.Title:
December 19, 2013


Honorable Michael McSweeney
City Clerk and Clerk of the Council
141 Worth Street
New York, New York 10013

Dear City Clerk McSweeney:

Pursuant to Section 42 of the New York City Charter, the Charter meeting of the 2014 Council of the city of New York will be held on Wednesday, January 8, 2014 at 12:00 noon, in the Council Chambers, second floor, City Hall, New York, New York.

Sincerely,


Christine C. Quinn
Speaker
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

Items.Title:

Honorable Michael McSweeney
City Clerk and Clerk of the Council
141 Worth Street
New York, New York 10013

Dear Mr. McSweeney:

The Commissioners of Elections at their meeting held on Tuesday, December 3, 2013 certified the November 5, 2013 General Election for Members of the City Council.

The Following have been elected:


1st	Margaret S. Chin	
2nd	Rosie Mendez	
3rd	Corey D. Johnson

Yours very truly,


Michael J. Ryan

Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Communication was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.MatterName: Board of Elections - List of Elected City Officials

Items.Title:
By Council Member Chin:

“Motion that pursuant to Section 46 of the New York City Charter, the 2010-2013 Rules of the Council as amended, be continued and in effect until new rules shall be adopted or said rules shall be otherwise amended or modified.”
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Continuation Of 2010-2013 Rules Of The Council, As Amended

Items.Title: ROLL CALL
The City Clerk will announce the results of the vote.
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) announced the results for the vote of M-3 as 51-0-0..

Items.Title:
The City Clerk will then open the floor for nominations for Speaker.
All nominations shall use the following form:

“I hereby nominate for the Office of the Speaker of the Council of the City of New York, Pursuant to Section 44 of the New York City Charter, for the term commencing January 1, 2014 and terminating December 31, 2017, Council Member Melissa Mark-Viverito.”

Although not required by the Rules, the City Clerk will ask if there is a second to the nomination.

After the nomination has been seconded the City Clerk will then ask:
“Are there any other nominations?”

If so, the same procedure as listed above shall be followed.

After all nominations have been made the City Clerk will state:
“I now close the nominations.”

The City Clerk will call the roll and announce the results and declare:

“The Council Member duly elected as the Speaker of the Council of the City of New York for the term commencing January 1, 2014 and terminating December 31, 2017 is Council Member Melissa Mark-Viverito.”

At the Speaker’s discretion, the designation of an Acting President Pro-Tempore may be made at this point.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Communication be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 172-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits, inspections and performance tests.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 172-A, Exemptions from the payment of fees for fire department permits, inspections and performance tests.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 859-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to submit to the council reports of crime in all parks and playgrounds within the City that are greater than one acre in size.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 859-A, Requiring the police department to submit to the council reports of crime in all parks and playgrounds within the City that are greater than one acre in size.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 867-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the creation of a voluntary master environmental hazard remediation technician registration program.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 867-A, Creation of a voluntary master environmental hazard remediation technician registration program.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 933-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating an animal abuse registry.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 933-A, Creating an animal abuse registry.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 1055-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City Police Department to report information concerning vehicle collisions in which a driver left the scene of the collision.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 1055-A, NYPD to report information concerning vehicle collisions in which a driver left the scene of the collision.

Items.Title: Communication from the Mayor (Michael R. Bloomberg) – Mayors veto and disapproval message of Introductory Number 1208-A, A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of sick time earned by employees.
Items.ActionText: This Mayor's Message was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Mayor's Veto - Int. No. 1208-A, Provision of sick time earned by employees.

Items.Title:
We, the undersigned members of the Minority (Republican) Delegation of the Council of the City of New York, hereby designate and appoint Vincent M. Ignizio as Minority Leader of the New York City Council, pursuant to Rule 4.10 of the Rules of the Council of the City of New York for a term commencing on January 1, 2014. 
Signed Vincent M. Ignizio, Eric Ulrich, Steven Matteo
Items.ActionName: Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council
Items.ActionText: This Petition was Rcvd, Ord, Prnt, Fld by Council

Items.Title:
By the Speaker:

“I nominate the following Council Members as Members of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections of the City Council:

	    	    Chair:	Council Member Lander

Committee Members:	Speaker Mark-Viverito
Council Member Richards
Council Member Espinal, Jr.
Council Member Chin
Council Member Rose
Council Member Rodriguez 

“For this roll call, the question on the floor is whether the Council would agree with and adopt such nominations.”

The Acting President Pro-Tempore will then state:

“Will the Clerk call the Roll.”

The City Clerk will announce the results of the vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Petition be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Nomination and Election of the Committee on Rules, Privileges and Elections

Items.Title:
The City Clerk states:
“I order the call to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed.”
Items.MinutesNote: The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) ordered the Call for the the Charter be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed.

Items.Title:
The City Clerk states:
“I order this communication to be Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed.”
Received, Ordered, Printed and Filed

Items.MinutesNote:
At this point, the City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) opened the floor for nominations for Speaker. 

Council Member Torres nominated Council Member Mark-Viverito for Speaker.

Council Members Barron, Dromm, Cornegy, Ferreras, and Garodnick seconded the nomination. 

     
      The City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) asked if there were any other nominations - hearing none, the City Clerk closed the nominations.

At this point, the City Clerk (Mr. McSweeney) announced the results of the Roll Call for M-4 and declared: 

"The Council Member duly elected as the Speaker of the Council of the City of New York for the term commencing January 1, 2014 and terminating December 31, 2017 is Council Member Melissa Mark-Viverito."

     At this point, the newly-elected Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito) spoke to all assembled in the Chambers.

     At the discretion of Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito), the Public Advocate (Ms. James) was then designated as the Acting President Pro Tempore.  At this point, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) assumed the Chair as the acting Presiding Officer.
At this point, the newly-elected Minority Leader (Council Member Ignizio) briefly spoke to those assembled in the Chambers.

The Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito)  made the following nominations to the Committee on Rules, Priveleges and Elections:

Brad S. Lander, Chair
Ydanis A. Rodriguez
Margaret S. Chin
Deborah Rose
Donovan J. Richards
Rafael Espinal
The Speaker (Council Member Mark-Viverito)

At this point, Council Member Chin moved pursuant to Section 46 of the New York City Charter, the 2010-2013 Rules of the Council, as amended, be continued and in effect until new rules shall be adopted or sai rules shall be otherwise amended or modified.
